attributes.action: Change the quarantine rule for UK returnees from Red List Countries.
attributes.additional_details: As government has enforced, UK retunurnees coming back from a Red List country have to abide by a 10 day quarantine period in a managed quarantine hotel. It makes sense for anyone with symptoms or proven diagnosis of covid 19 to comply. However, before being the subject of this law, it is logical for a person to undergo a test prior to being placed into quarantine. Why should anyone have to pay for a quarantine that may not need. If their test is negative, they shouldn't have to quarantine, but rather quarantine at home as a precaution.
attributes.background: Change the red list quarantine rule for people who have evidence of testing negative, for covid 19.

rejection.details:
You may like to sign these two petitions we currently have open on this topic:

No hotel quarantine for UK citizens, permanent residents and their families
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/571447

Allow fully vaccinated people coming from red list countries to isolate at home
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588072
